title: topr plotting functions
text:
Examples of basic usage. For more examples on how to use each plotting function select the corresponding function name from the top navigation bar.
library(topr)

title: manhattan
text:
library(topr)


manhattan(CD_UKBB)








Annotate the top association peaks with the nearest gene

manhattan(CD_UKBB, annotate=5e-09)








Extract the lead snps and display them in red on the manhattan plot

lead_snps <- get_lead_snps(CD_UKBB, thresh = 5e-09, region_size = 10000000)


manhattan(list(CD_UKBB, lead_snps), 
          annotate=c(5e-100, 5e-09), 
          color=c("darkblue","red"), 
          legend_labels=c("CD UKBB", "Lead snp's"), verbose=F) 








Change the annotation to vertical and italic. Reduce the size of all text by setting the scale argument to 0.9. Move the legend labels to the top.


Click here to see the command 


manhattan(list(CD_UKBB, lead_snps), 
          annotate=c(5e-100, 5e-09), 
          color=c("darkblue","red"), 
          legend_labels=c("CD UKBB", "Lead snp's"), 
          size=c(1,1.7),
          shape=c(19,8), 
          label_size = 3.7, 
          angle = 90, 
          label_fontface = "italic", 
          nudge_y = 5, 
          scale=0.9, 
          legend_position = "top", 
          ymax=32,  
          even_no_chr_lightness = c(0.8,0.5),
          verbose=F) 











Click here to see the command 



mh









Click here to see the command 


top_snps_finngen <- get_lead_snps(CD_FINNGEN)
mh <- manhattan(list(CD_UKBB, lead_snps, top_snps_finngen),  color=c("red","darkred","gray40"),label_fontface = c("italic","bold","plain"), angle=c(90,0,0),
          legend_labels = c("CD","top snps UKB", "top snps Finngen"),annotate=1e-20, build=enshuman::hg38)

title: topr plotting functions
text:
regionplot

Single GWAS

regionplot(CD_UKBB, gene="IL23R", annotate=5e-9)

[1] "Zoomed to region:  1:67038907-67359979"











Multi GWAS

regionplot(list(CD_UKBB, CD_FINNGEN), gene="IL23R", annotate=5e-9)

[1] "Use the legend_labels argument to change the legend labels from color names to meaningful labels! "
[1] "Zoomed to region:  1:67038907-67359979"

title: manhattan
text:
library(topr)


manhattan(CD_UKBB)








Annotate the top association peaks with the nearest gene

Change the annotation to vertical and italic. Reduce the size of all text by setting the scale argument to 0.9. Move the legend labels to the top.


Click here to see the command

          annotate=c(5e-100, 5e-09),

          shape=c(19,8),

          ymax=32,  
          even_no_chr_lightness = c(0.8,0.5),

title: topr plotting functions
text:
effectplot

effectplot(list(CD_UKBB, CD_FINNGEN), annotate=5e-4)









 effectplot(list(CD_FINNGEN, CD_UKBB), color = get_topr_colors()[2], annotate=5e-4)

title: topr plotting functions
text:
qqtopr

qqtopr(CD_UKBB)
